properties.title: Commons SCXML Usecases - Dialog Management Strategy for rdc:group
properties.author: Commons Documentation Team

section.name: SCXML documents to configure RDC group container instances
section.p:
Reusable Dialog Components (RDC) Framework is "a framework for creating JSP taglibs that aid in rapid development of voice and multimodal applications". The RDC Framework defines a <group> container for aggregating multiple components in one view. The dialog management across the child components for a group is pluggable, more details are available on this RDC wiki page on
aggregation. A Commons SCXML driven dialog management strategy has been incorporated into the RDC Framework, as seen
here.

ul.li: SCXML semantics are based on UML state charts, and provide an easy transition from the modeling layer to the runtime artifacts.
The SCXML based strategy is more expressive than the precursor strategies that were previously available in the RDC distribution.

section.name: Example
section.p: To illustrate the use of the SCXML strategy for <rdc:group>, consider a simple air travel information speech dialog, which prompts the user for the trip type (one way or round trip), and collect either one travel date or two depending on the answer.

subsection.name: UML Diagram
subsection.p: Here is the UML state machine diagram that represents this SCXML-based travel information speech dialog.

subsection.name: Code
subsection.p: That gives us the following JSP snippet, if named variable today contains the MMddyyyy string for the current date:
subsection.pre:
<rdc:group id="travelInfo" strategy="org.apache.taglibs.rdc.dm.SCXMLDialog" config="travel-dialog.xml">
<rdc:select1 id="tripType" options="travel-types.xml" echo="true" />
<rdc:usMajorCity id="departureCity" />
<rdc:usMajorCity id="arrivalCity" />
<rdc:date id="departureDate" minDate="${today}" confirm="true"/>
<rdc:date id="arrivalDate" minDate="${departureDate}" confirm="true" />
</rdc:group>
subsection.p: View the RDC documentation in Jakarta Taglibs for packaging and deployment as a web application.
